Authors:
Milan Spetik, Pokluda Robert, BERRAF TEBBAL AKILA, Ales
Eichmeier
Title:
Pyrenochaetopsis kuksensis (Pyrenochaetopsidaceae), a new
species associated with an ornamental boxwood in the Czech Republic
Keywords:
Buxus sempervirens, Fungi, Phylogeny, Pyrenochaetopsis,
Taxonomy
Abstract:
During the investigation of fungal microbiome associated
with boxwood in the Czech Republic, samples from Buxus sempervirens L.
(Buxaceae) plants were collected and used for isolation. Two fungal
strains were proposed as a new species Pyrenochaetopsis kuksensis based
on morphology as well as phylogenetic analyses of ITS, LSU, rpb2, and
tub2 sequence data. Detailed descriptions and phylogenetic relationships
of the new taxon were provided.
